Caution: In the evening they get busy, lately they have been getting busy with take-out orders so when you go might see few people fuming for their delayed pick-up orders, so plan accordingly. But owner AJ is a very personable and tries his best. It's been a while since Haight street had a good Indian/Nepal restaurant, I am really thankful for this place and looking forward to enjoy this place for a long long time into the future.
author: Sean S.

description: I cannot count how many times I have relied on this place to feed me and keep me satisfied when I cannot find the time to cook.
author: Akash M.

description: We ordered chicken tikka, spinach paneer, butter naan, rice, and raita. So delish. Our new go to spot for pickup!
author: Jillian P.

description:
Easy 5 stars for my favorite  OM  Indian restaurant in san francisco .  I have driven way out of my way just to dine here and carry-out.  Brought my picky and hard-to-impress a friend  here last night with his wifey, and they loved it.

Big props to the owner & management who run this place like a well-oiled machine with stellar service each time.  Our water cups were never even half empty!  The complimentary rice pudding after each dinner is always a nice touch as well!



As for the food recommendations;

Lamb samosas mixed with the sweet plum chutney and slightly-spicy green chutney with a touch of the pickled vegetables is a must! (Note: If you aren't using the trifecta of "sauces" then you aren't doing it right!)

Navratan Korma is my favorite veggie dish! Sweet, creamy and compliments anything spicy on the table.

Bengan Bhartha also has a sweet after-taste, but the best part about this eggplant based curry is that you can hardly taste the eggplant, which is great for someone like me who isn't a big fan of eggplant!

The Tikka Masala (chicken or paneer), the Alu Vindaloo, the Aloo Matar, and the variety of Naan (especially the garlic basil) are TEXTBOOK classic here!

Tired the Lamb Biryani last night for the first time, and it truly was "highly aromatic" with a nice spicy kick.  Also the lamb pieces were generous!

Everything is reasonably priced and you can customize the spicy level of each dish from mild-to-medium-to-spicy.

All I can say is thank you Om indian cuisine  !!!

will be back soon
author: Ford T.

description: Delicious Indian food, could eat there every day. Friendly staff, prompt service, great area.
author: Denise L.

description: The food is delicious, but it gave me food poisoning. I got the chicken vindaloo on Sunday evening, and on Wednesday, I'm still nauseated and having serious stomach issues. Don't trust the meat dishes here.
author: Nick S.

description: This has become my favorite Indian Restaurant! After a resent neighborhood move, I was thrilled to discover this gem of a place in the Haight. The food is fresh, served hot ( no buffet ) by a charming and thorough wait staff. I personally like spicy hot, but the heat of the dishes is negotiable and the servers are especially helpful in recommending heat as well as menu items. Papadum, a wafer thin cracker is brought to the table right after you order with 3 sauces, a spicy, a sweet and a mint chutney. Their Daal soup is some of the best I have had. Thick and temperature hot with bits of lentils and goodness. I love the Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo and my vegetable favorite is the Aloo Gobi. Potatoes and cauliflower cooked perfectly. Tender but with a tooth... not mushy. A lovely cup of Masala Chai is a great finish especially on a cool foggy San Francisco afternoon. A great restaurant that I find myself in weekly. Give it a try...,
author: Michael T.

description: Ordered delivery from this restaurant for the first time, and it took two hours! By the time the food got here, it was cold. Food itself was ... fine. Not bad by any means, but not better than many of the other Indian restaurants that deliver to SF--in less than two hours. I will not be ordering from here again.
author: J. D.

description: "Om" must be short for "OMG This Food Sucks." Late, cold, skimpy portions...there are a ton of South Asian options in this town - I recommend you find another.
author: Hugh G.

description: I'm fairly convinced that the positive reviews on this place are from family and friends. We ordered takeout from here and both got food poisoning. The chicken curry had no flavor and the cream broke so it looked curdy and gross. The eggplant curry was ok? We didn't eat that much of anything we ordered  (because this was the worst Indian food we've come across in a long time) and it still messed with us. Never getting food from this restaurant again.
author: Ella M.

description:
Stopped in here on a Saturday while out and about, and was pleasantly surprised to find a great Indian restaurant on Haight Street! We were greeted immediately by the owner and promptly seated. The dining room was cozy and tastefully decorated, despite the fact they had only been open for a couple days. There's also a larger dining/banquet room in the back. 

First we had some Papadum wafer appetizers, served with 3 dipping sauces.

Upon the owner's suggestion, I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, which he insisted was different/better than what is served elsewhere. It didn't disappoint. Sauce was a creamy coconut curry, and perfectly seasoned. Chicken was moist and tender(so simple, but so important!). We also tried the Lamb Rogan Josh. Not sure about the story behind the name of this dish, but it certainly satisfied my craving for lamb, along with a little heat(medium spicy). Loved the spice combination and garlic in the sauce and the lamb was, yet again, very tender.

We ordered basmati rice and fresh naan with the meal which, in my opinion, is a must.

After speaking with the owner, I learned he was actually from Nepal and legit, explaining the presence of some of the Himalayan dishes on the menu.

Honestly, my only regret is that I didn't try more stuff here. I'll need to go back and delve deeper in to the menu, which I'm looking forward to!
author: Jeff K.

description: The service was absolutely horrible and one of the delivery men sat at the bar and picked his nose for like 20 minutes. Usually I wouldn't say anything about that, but It was disgusting and went on for so long, and he was handling the food! It was so gross, the food took forever, and the price was more than it was worth. The food was good but I definitely will not be eating there again. I will give them this, the curry and the naan was good, but we got this lamb dish that was completely overcooked and dry and we could barely chew it. I would. It recommend this place.
author: Nikki D.

description: OM Indian is one of my best restaurant in San Francisco ! Ordered Chicken MoMo, Tandoori Mixed Grilled,Garlic Naan the night before,food was on door in 45 minutes, I couldn't stop licking my plate ! Their food is awesome ! Highly recommended to you people ! Thank you Om Indian !
author: Bhuwan A.

description: So great. Fast delivery on a Sunday evening (a bit less than 1 hr at 5:30 pm). Chicken tikka masala between mild/med heat. Absolutely the most perfect flavor, nicely tender. Creamy and lightly, productively spiced but not too much heat. Ordered basmati rice - good. Then garlic naan & veg samosas (bc of delivery minimum). Best samosas I have had yet. Can't pinpoint how except the filling might be the most accurate texture/flavor combo. Garlic naan was missing upon delivery - but I promptly called and they refunded my money. The quality, the flavor, the variety all equal an A+ meal. I loved WP Clay Oven before but somehow this surpasses that as delivery! Happily surprised.
author: Shannon C.

description: I haven't been into this location, but I've ordered take-out a million times. My favorite Indian in the city!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Nothing negative to say about this wonderful place!! I order take out from here very often, and over half the time it's after nine o'clock. I've worked in restaurants and I would hate when people would order food right before we closed. I get off late though, and everything I've tried is delicious! Regardless of what time I order or what dish I choose, everything comes hot and just as good as the first time!
author: Chrissy L.

description: I ordered delivery through Yelp app. Food arrived on time and quickly. Best Indian food we have had in a while. Tasted fresh and not over salted. Highly recommend.
author: Iggy R.

description: Great, fresh Indian food that doesn't feel greasy or cooked to oblivion. Hard to find good Indian in SF, and this new place is promising! Better than others in Inner Sunset/Haight area that I've tried. Super nice staff, too. Vegetable Biryani was especially delicious.
author: Elise R.

description: Yummy! Have ordered takeout from here several times and always been pleased. The flavors are good and unique - you can actually taste the differences between the different curries. Delivery is generally timely and no glitches. However I do want to say that we ordered "spicy" for butter chicken and it looked like a lot of chili sauce had just been added to it... and it hurt going down. So, in the future we will stick with medium.
author: J L.

description:
The delivered food was okay, but the service was terrible.  

Delivery took forever.  We made clear that delivery was to us in bar.  They delivered the food with no utensils.  No forks.  We called and asked about forks, and they told us that the delivery person had no forks in the car with him and that it was our fault for not having asked for forks.

How ridiculous is that?
author: T R.

description: I've tried the Chicken Tikka Masala and it is unique but delicious. The Paneer kadai was amazing as well. So glad to have a great Indian place around the corner
author: Noms U.

description: Quality food with reasonable price and very nice customer service. The chicken momos are awesome and delicious.
author: Venu Gopal V.

description: I ordered delivery from these guys and it was estimated at a 50-60 min delivery time. So i was really surprised when they showed up at my doorstep 30 minutes after i placed my order. The samosas were piping hot and crunchy on the outside. The garlic naan was buttery and LARGE! And butter chicken (my all time favorite) was tasty! Maybe i should actually pay them a visit next time. Thank you for the good delivery experience!
author: Jenn Z.

description:
I was so disappointed with this order (we did pickup) after seeing all the positive reviews. I was really looking forward to a new Indian restaurant for our rotation.

My chief complaints: it's about 20% more expensive than the other places we order from. That would be ok if it was the only problem, but combined with the food not being very good, we probably won't order from Om again.

We ordered:
- Papadum, $1.50 - fine. Was a little darker than I'm used to but perfectly fine.
- Tandoori Chicken Wings, $9.95 these were good.
- Tandoori Assorted, $10.95 - fine. No grizzly meats, so that's good. But they were missing a nice little tangy kick.
- Spicy Mixed Vegetables Soup, $5.95 - first disappointment: for the price, it was a tiny portion. And the flavor was lame, and the clear soup had some kind of thickening agent that made it more like Chinese gelatinous soup. Very low on flavor. Certainly no kick from anything lemony. Highly overpriced.
- Chicken Mulligatawny Soup, $5.95 - also a tiny portion. Very low on flavor. Highly overpriced.
- Baigan Bharta (Vegan), $10.95 - fine. Nothing special.
- Bhindi Masala (Vegan), $10.95 - low on flavor. 
- Mushroom Matar (Vegan), $10.95 - fine.
- Chicken Tikka Kebab, $12.95 - fine. Also missing that nice tikka tangy kick.
- Butter Chicken Masala, $12.95 - fine.
- Tandoori Roti, $2.00 - low on flavor.
- Laccha Paratha, $3.95 - low on flavor.
- Jeera Rice, $4.50 - nothing special. normal rice. highly overpriced.
Total bill was $125, which was a bit higher than our usual dinner for 2 adults, 3 kids and leftovers for the next day. And the food was really mediocre.
author: Lucia W.

description: Definitely a significant improvement over what was there previously (under several different names), but that wouldn't have been hard.  There's finally acceptable Indian food at this location.  Solid, but not wonderful.  I have ordered several times, and like another reviewer has mentioned, the chicken (in several different dishes) has always been overcooked and tough.  The sauces are good.  The highlight of the meal is always the samosas--the pastry is not too thick or brittle, and the insides are flavorful.
author: King R.

description: I loooove my Indian food, and this place is not only delicious, but they also deliver...um, hello, best of all worlds! The paneer tikka masala was exactly what I needed on this cold night. Also, I must add, the delivery guy was super nice and right on time. I will definitely be coming back to this place!
author: A.E. M.

description: I love Indian food so much. I think there was a stint where I would order delivery from Om, once a week. Oops. Somosas are delicious and huge. Saag Paneer is okay. It had an interesting aftertaste and I have only ordered it once. Chicken Tikka Masala I usually always order. It is so creamy and I love getting it spicy. It's very spicy, but I'm into that. Definitely, terrible for you with how creamy it is. Lamb Curry is delicious. I love the curry itself. The lamb is tender, but a little gamy tasting. Garlic Naan is a must. They have the best naan. I also like the Serrano chili naan, but just prefer garlic. Rice is cooked perfectly.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: I had yet to be impressed by Indian food on the pacific coast....until we came to Om! There were five of us and they were careful to make sure our order was correct. The owner was personable and even gave us a free appetizer after some cheerful chatter. The food was delicious!!! There was a wait to get our food yet it was well worth it. We did have a show to get to so they were happy to make sure the bill was brought out timely and worked with our various payment methods. They are still setting up the back dining room yet the smell of new carpet did not take away from the delicious food.
author: Amanda F.

description: I was pleasantly surprised about just how good this food was. I had almost given up on good Indian food delivery. We ordered the special combo for 2, which came with tons of food, enough for leftovers the next day, at least for one person. (Having enough for leftovers is one of my main criteria for judging a delivery place.) All of the food was very flavorful without being too spicy. The naan was also perfect, as were the samosas. Yes, it was a little on the pricey side for Indian, but it seems like there is nothing affordable left in this city.
author: Amy B.

description: I came here with some friends just randomly and we loved our experience!! Our waiter was so funny and the food is very fast and delish! Highly recommend to anyone who wants to try some authentic Indian food!
author: Cecily D.

description: I was trolling around height street, when I saw this new place I first hesitate to give a try because I had a bad experience with previous name. I tried their tandoori chicken, it was perfect. Chicken was well cooked and right amount of onions. I tried their Gallic naan which was the best naan ever had. Server and waiters are  very friendly. I only regret is I didn't try their other food. Restaurant was super clean and nice aroma as soon as I entered. I recommend this new restaurant to my friends and family
author: Sugam K.

description: Really good flavors, but they're definitely not subtle. The momo are kind of overwhelmingly seasoned (good, but in small quantities). I would have liked the samosa a bit more crisp on the outside, but otherwise really good. I ordered the chana masala spicy, and it was well balanced -- definitely some heat, but not overboard. A good 4 out of 5 on the spicy scale. Prices are good, delivery took over an hour on a Monday night.
author: Kelly B.

description: This place is kind of close to where I live so the delivery was way faster than I expected. The food was also really good.
author: Lori L.

description: After my last review of Om I was contacted by the owner and was told they were having trouble with their ovens the night I placed my order. I can definitely understand not having a good night. Considering the owner reached out to me to apologize personally I decided I would give Om a redo. I decided cto go in person this time. I realized that the location has gone through several changes. Originally it use to be Tikki Masala, then I think it became Tikki Masala Indian Pizza. My previous experience at those past incantations was average at best. I'm happy to report that Om has renovated everything and it actually a very nice semi formal restaurant. All the previous diner furniture has been replaced and all the employees wear a formal uniform. We ordered two entrees, an appetizer, and some naan. Everything came out in a timely manner and was cooked to perfection. The service was top notch and I couldn't have had a smoother dining experience. All in all I'm glad I came back to Om. I have no doubt my previous experience was a one off. I look forward to coming back to Om in the future. It is definitely the best Indian restaurant in the Haight.
author: Thomas Crown O.

description: Just one experience, but terrific delivered food. Oh I hope they stay this good! Excellent garlic naan, saag paneer, butter chicken masala, lamb chops. Came hot and we specified one dish medium hot and one mild and that's exactly how they came!
author: Jane M.

description:
We found parking on Haight Street and started trolling for a restaurant. We walked past a newer looking Indian restaurant and after reviewing the few Yelp comments we decided to try it. Good move! This place is only 8 days old and has excellent service, fresh food and beautiful interiors with painted murals depicting Indian life and landscapes.

We ordered aloo gobi, coconut curry, nann, lamb saag that was a lamb shank. Great place for vegetarians.
author: Robert T.

description: Strictly reviewing their delivery, not the ambience. Fast, friendly, delicious, consistent.
author: Dylan P.

description: Ordered pakora, vegetarian momo and dahl makheni. All were great. Delivery was fast. Delivery guy was very friendly. A bit regretting I didn't tip him more.
author: Michael R.

description: Good food. Service has a way to go but they're still finding their feet. Very excited.
author: Andrew M.

description: Very good Indian food, delicious layering of spices in all the dishes. Went there for a late lunch....we were the only table in the restaurant. Seating was in a back room, kind of made for an odd experience. Our server was part of the family that owned the restaurant, he was very kind and helpful.
author: Miriam W.

description:
This has been the best addition to the neighborhood in a long time!  We haven't had a great Indian spot in Upper Haight and now with Om Indian Cuisine we really do.  I used to have to go to Lower Haight for my Indian fix but I now prefer this to the further options I used to visit.  This is now a once a week place for me and I hope they have success in this location.  The staff is also really nice.

I've tried a few of the things here, such as the Biryani, Tikka Masala, and the Chicken Korma.  For me, the Korma really stands out - this is my new go to.

I haven't eaten inside yet but the place looks really good - they clearly did a lot of work after taking over from the previous establishment.  One area that I think could be improved are the expected pick up times - there's a huge variance when you order online and it's hard to tell when I should come in to get my pickup.  However, this is a new restaurant and I'm sure this will improve with time.  

Great addition to the area, I'll certainly be back in often!
author: Max B.

description: I ordered during lunch time of day, it was very nice, especially I liked kind of spices they use, and the meal was hot when arrived.
author: Henry G.

description: We do delivery from this place a few times a month. The food is amazing, and so is the delivery speed. I'd recommend trying Malai Kofta here. Its the best!
author: Sam G.

description: Loved the food we ordered, the tandoori mixed grill and the chicken Tikka masala was our favorite!! The art work in the back room was amazing too:)
author: Maryam K.

description: I ordered Om Indian Cuisine through Eat 24 over the rainy weekend and was very pleasantly surprised with both the quality of the food and the time of delivery. It was stormy and a complete mess outside but the delivery arrived early, I think in under 30 minutes - a first for me for any delivery in SF! The food was flavorful and fresh when it arrived. This will be my new go-to Indian spot for those lazy nights in! You won't be disappointed.
author: Jessica W.

description: Today I visited this restaurant and I got a great response from the restaurant people.... The interior was nicely decorated. I was welcomed with free papadum. The sauce came with papadum had amazing flavor. I ordered  tikka masala, garlic naan and chicken tikka kebab it was so fast and very yummy...  Naan was like a foot long, tikka kebab was well cooked and chicken tikka masala is the best so far. I would definitely recommend and visit again to this fancy restaurant in upper haight
author: Anil P.

description: Had dinner in om Indian restaurant the menu was exquisite and the service was excellent the most tasty chicken tikka masala I had in the Bay Area and lastly I ordered mango lassi the taste was out of this world.the best part is that everything is served a la carte from the menu. I also asked them about home deliveries and they have told me that they do free home delivery service to their customers.one of the best Indian restaurants in the Bay Area
author: Bhargav Tej Kumar Reddy S.

description: This is probably the best food I ever had. Momo is excelent. I really appreciate the cook and waiter who serve such a good food in the time even the customers are full. I will definetly visit next time. best of luck.
author: Kshitij S.

description: Oh my goodness, I eill never forget the Basmati rice meal I had the last time I was there with friends. Loved the curries and pilau. All were well served!
author: Kirk C.

description: I came by yesterday while strolling around height and ashbury. I was so impressed by the quality of their food, considering that I went there on the second day of opening. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and it definitely surpassed my expectations. The chicken was so juicy and tender and the sauce was creamy and coconutty. I'm proud to say that, that was the best chicken tikka masala I have ever had! Even though this place is still under some construction, it has a pretty chill vibe the service was adequate. I will for sure come back and try their other selections of food.
author: Ashley O.

description: Great food. Great service. I came here the other day with my friends. We looked on Yelp for Indian food nearby and the reviews here are right. The food is fantastic.
author: James F.

description: I heard from the manager after my previous review and gave the place another chance. They've really turned things around with customer service and I am now a regular (I primarily use them for delivery and take out )
author: June O.

description: Fabulous food and friendly environment.specifically chicken tikka malasa was very tasty
author: Madadi R.

description: I've never been to India so I don't know how authentic the food is but I really liked it. It's a big step up from its two predecessors. The owner Ajay (sp?) is young, ambitious, and wants to provide good food and service.I had both.  The chai spices are subtle and not overwhelming.  The creamy tikka masala has a hint of spiciness which I like.  Had a choice of little to heavy heat.  The mango chutney and raita are a nice accompaniment .  The chicken was tender and fresh.  I took 1/2 my order home to save for dinner. It was even better reheated.  I can't give it 4 stars cause it's so new and will have growing pains.
author: Alston L.

description: Om delivers to my house. Good fresh vegan food; reasonably priced, mild as I ask for and doesn't upset my stomach like some other places. Always on time.
author: Rima S.

description: We finally found a good Indian restaurant! We've been searching since we moved to the city for our go-to Indian place. Who'd have thought this would be the place!? The Chana masala was just like homemade, garlic naan was delicious, baingan was perfect. This is an Indian restaurant that we'd bring our Indian family to.
author: Josef N.

description: We stopped by yesterday with our family of six and were initially a little wary as the decor was still being finished. However we were VERY impressed with the food. The butter chicken and daal makhani were the best we have had for a long time. The lamb was amazingly tender in the kebabs. It's a pity we are visiting from NJ otherwise we would be here again next week !
author: Kiera H.

description: Amazing food. The tandoori wings and all things tandoori on the menu are a must. One of the best Indian spots in the city!
author: G W.

description: Ordered the chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and rice pudding. Everything was delicious and the fresh basil they provided was such a nice topping. Free delivery was nice. I couldn't finish all of the food but I will definitely have some of my leftovers later. So good!
author: Sean S.

description: Came in with a friend at 6-it was completely dead and they sat us down. The waitress was so abrupt and rude. She was walking away when finishing my order and wasn't pleasant. The Chana masala and naan was pretty good but the in house service and vibes are not good. Would recommend the the food though
author: Campbell R.

description: i'm really conflicted bc the food is super good but i found a giant cockroach in the rice last time i got it so.. maybe ill come back after they exterminate
author: Nicole S.

description: Om is really good.  It is fresh, tasty and a pleasure to eat.  We like the Masala very much, but also enjoy other dishes (the curries are great too).  I recommend this restaurant without any hesitation.  Enjoy
author: Michael D.

description: Haight lacked good Indian food for a while. Being an Indian, this is good comfort food. Friendly staff and quick service is awesome.
author: Chi A.

description: If your looking for an authentic indian restaurant look no more, this place is really good.We came in with a group of friends on a busy day,We ordered chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and tandoori chicken.We liked all these dishes and chicken tikka masala yummy and the best i have tried in the bay area.Overall this place is really nice,delicious food.
author: Soma A.

description: Om Indian cusian has best flavor of Indian food.  They have good collections of local draft beers too. I ordered chicken 65 , saag paneer,chicken tikka masala and chicken achari. Everything so delicious. I never had that flavor of tikka masala anywhere in Bay Area and samosa was cooked perfectly and crispy.l'll come back again.
author: Krishna K.

description: Don't know exactly from where I could start... I wasn't aware of this place until i step in... I was greeted as soon as I entered later I came to realise that he's the owner of that place Mr.aj Not too clumsy good scape between the tables which gives some privacy which has been lacked now a days beyond that we were given enough time and complimentary papad mean while we had a good glance at the menu.... Here's the real part which proves the class of the restaurant in which this place has excelled.... Can't say one particular dish is delicious I tried some pakoras tandoori chkn wings and the chicken tikka masala with garlic naan and some basmati rice which are really mouth watering, it's better to try this kind of place which is run by an individual who treats each and every customer in a well mannered way which makes people feel comfortable who came to dine out with some hunger,celebrate their memorable spl movements obviously expect some hospitality which these guys had plenty some ova here with some delicious mouth watering tasty food started  loving this place hope to see you guys soon... You guys gonna rock for sure,I wish you guys a very good luck.
author: Phani C.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood. Went in expecting the same take out place that had been there before and was pleasantly surprised to see a white tablecloth restaurant. The owner was very friendly and food very good. Watch out for the spicy food as my 16 year old learned the hard way!
author: Megan M.

description: Great food and service.  We had the tandoori chicken, mono, okra, and shrimp curry and it was delicious
author: Amit P.

description: Excellent breads, good curries. Friendly staff and pleasant atmosphere.
author: Nick N.
